settings.content: For theme information and support, please visit [our support area](http://empy.re/support).
Happy with Providence and/or help you've received from our support team?
[Leave a quick review](https://themes.shopify.com/themes/providence/styles/seaside#reviews) to let others know about your experience.
All of the theme text can be changed in the theme's Languages area.
1. Click on the 'Themes' link in the main Shopify admin menu.
2. Click on the actions button (three dots) for Providence and then 'Edit language' in the menu that appears.
3. Click on 'English' in the list of available languages.
4. Locate and replace the text you'd like to change.
5. Click the 'Save' button to save the language.

Providence offers full support for [Google Web Fonts](http://www.google.com/webfonts). Simply choose any font from the library and type its exact name into one of the 'Google font' inputs below.
Using a Google Web Font will override that section's base font selection (the base font selection will be used as a fallback).
Add your own custom CSS to the following preloaded file:
It's all ready to go and includes media queries that match the theme's built-in responsive breakpoints, so you can easily target specific screen sizes if required.
1. Click on the 'Edit HTML/CSS' link at the top of this page.
2. Click on the 'Assets' folder in the sidebar of the template editor.
3. Click on the file to open it for editing.
4. Add your custom CSS and click the 'Save' button.
Add your own custom JavaScript to the following preloaded file:
It's all ready to go and includes a document.ready function for running jQuery or other functions once the page has completely loaded.

The theme loads jQuery in noConflict mode, so any code you might copy and paste from a tutorial should either be added to the custom scripts file or have all of the $ symbols replaced with the word jQuery.
Learn more about jQuery's noConflict mode in the [jQuery documentation](http://api.jquery.com/jquery.noconflict).
1. Click on the 'Edit HTML/CSS' link at the top of this page.
2. Click on the 'Assets' folder in the sidebar of the template editor.
3. Click on the file to open it for editing.
4. Add your custom JavaScript and click the 'Save' button.

Enabling multiple currencies allows your visitors to select which currency prices are displayed in. This does not affect transactions though as Shopify will always process the checkout in your shop's operating currency (which can be set by clicking on the 'Settings' link in the Shopify admin menu).

Rates used by Shopify are refreshed twice a day and pulled from [xe.com](http://www.xe.com). Rates are automatically scheduled for 00:00 GMT and 07:00 GMT though the updates are part of a long list of jobs that are run at this time. Jobs on this list are usually completed within a couple of hours of the scheduled time.
For the 'Currencies to display' and 'Default currency' settings below, use the [ISO 4217 3-letter currency codes](http://www.xe.com/iso4217.php) separated by spaces (e.g. CAD USD).
The default Shopify behaviour is to display the cart page each time a product is added to the cart.

The AJAX Add to Cart feature provides a smoother shopping experience for your visitors by displaying an unobtrusive confirmation when a product is added to the cart instead of redirecting to the cart page.

Enabling the outdated browser notice displays a friendly message to visitors using IE8 or lower to let them know that their browser is antiquated and that an upgrade is recommended (via [browsehappy.com](http://browsehappy.com)) to ensure the best possible experience.
This is the same method used by the popular [HTML5 Boilerplate](http://html5boilerplate.com/).

settings.content: The sidebar can easily be enabled or disabled for various areas of your shop. Simply select which locations you'd like it to appear in from the list below.
Build your sidebar by selecting a widget for each position.
Individual widget settings can be accessed via the previous panel.
Build your footer by selecting a widget for each position.
Individual widget settings can be accessed via the previous panel.
The total of all column widths should be 12.
To use the newsletter sign-up form you will need to have a [MailChimp](http://mailchimp.com/) account.
Learn more about integrating MailChimp with the newsletter widget [here](http://empy.re/documentation/shopify/providence/setting-up-mailchimp).
We built [Tweets](http://tweets.empy.re) to let you customize the look of your Twitter feed with your own text colors, link colors, avatar sizes, fonts and more.
Since you're using one of our themes adding Tweets is simple - just select 'Tweets App' for the 'Show feed using' option above and then install the app by clicking this link:
Alternatively, you can use the default Twitter widget which is limited (not by us!) to the customization options below.
